BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date: 08.02.2005 
 
AVSEC ORDER NO. 04 /2005 
 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau 
of Civil Aviation Security for the purpose of securing the safety of aircraft 
operation, directs that the following orders shall be implemented   with immediate 
effect: 
 
(i) 
During the course of audit, inspection/tests (dummy checks) if a 
screener fails in the test, the Inspecting/ authorized  Officer shall 
give a notice in writing (format enclosed as Appendix ‘A’) to the 
Airport Director, Station Manager of concerned airline/CASO to 
remove the said screener from screening duties with immediate 
effect. He will not be deployed the screening jobs till he is trained 
and re-certified as per the prescribed procedure. 
 
(ii) 
 It shall be the responsibility of the concerned Airport Director, Chief  
Airport Security Officer, Station Manager, as the case may be, to 
withdraw the screener referred in Para (i) above, from screening 
duties and to make necessary alternate arrangement to ensure 
continuity of AVSEC operations at the airport.    
 
 
 
( R.C. Tayal ) 
 Commissioner of Security (CA)  
 
 
Distribution 
As per list attached.
